newsitem.title: USA: Morrison Knudsen wins Indonesian contracts.
newsitem.headline: Morrison Knudsen wins Indonesian contracts.

text.p: Morrison Knudsen Corp said it was awarded two services contracts recently secured in Indonesia for undisclosed terms.

The first is to perform a feasibility study for Jakarta-based P.T. Kitadin for the mine development of the Tandung Mayang Project. This mine will be located in East Kalimantan and is projected to be in operation in 1998 at a production level of up to one million tonnes per year.
The second award was from the P.T. Bukit Asam/P.T. MAPCO Indonesia joint venture to provide a pre-feasibility mine and development plan for a project in Sumatra, Indonesia.
